availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Bowling Green, Kentucky attorney. Madison County, Kentucky native. Graduated from Centre College in 1843. Married Mary Frances Grider Rodes in 1849. Father of Henry Clifton Rodes, William Owsley Rodes, Rachel Rodes, and Sally Rodes. Served in the Kentucky House of Representatives from 1853 to 1855.

bibl.p: Manuscripts and Folklife Archives, “Rodes Collection (MSS 427),” MSS Finding Aids, Paper 2464, December 14, 2012, p. 1, http://digitalcommons.wku.edu/dlscmssfin_aid/2464. Lewis Collins and Richard H. Collins, History of Kentucky, Volume II (Covington, KY: Collins and Company, 1878), p. 738. Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, District 1. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, Bowling Green, District 2, p. 3. Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registrations, 1863-1865, Ancestry, Kentucky, Third Congressional District, Warren County, 1864. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, Bowling Green, p. 88.
